intro: Androsace albana var. wiedemannii, commonly known as the alpine sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette and are covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. This species thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
